business.headline: Sufficient stock, India won't face immediate oil disruption amid Iran crisisIndia imports 88 per cent of its crude oil – the raw material for making fuels like petrol and diesel – and about half of its requirement for natural gas - the feedstock for generating electricity, producing fertiliser, fuel for household kitchens and CNG for automobiles – and cooking gas LPG.

India built UPI and Aadhaar, is it time for an Aatmanirbhar credit score too?A three-digit number may look small on paper. But for millions of Indians, it quietly decides how far they can go. India built digital infrastructure for identity (AADHAAR) and payment (UPI). The next question is whether credit deserves the same clarity and control.

Warner Bros Discovery signs $110 billion deal with Paramount SkydanceWarner Bros Discovery agreed to a $110 billion acquisition by Paramount Skydance after Netflix declined to match the offer, creating a media powerhouse set to reshape Hollywood and streaming competition.

From FDs to mutual funds: How Indians are changing their investment behaviourFor years, FDs and real estate were the first choice for Indian savers seeking safety and certainty. Now, mutual funds are steadily gaining popularity, especially among first-time investors looking for higher returns. Is this the beginning of a long-term shift in how Indians invest?

India's Q3 GDP grows 7.8% as government rolls out new base year seriesThe Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation introduced a new series of GDP estimates with 2022-23 as the base year, replacing the earlier 2011-12 base.

Sensex, Nifty fall over 1% as global worries mount; auto, financial shares tankThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.

Pakistan to run short of flour? Wheat output likely to fall amid Afghanistan warAccording to a report by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), Pakistan's wheat production is expected to decline by 2 to 2.2 million tonnes compared to last year.

Including property in your will? Here's how to avoid family and legal conflictsA house is often the most valuable thing people leave behind. Yet, without proper details in a Will, like ownership clarity, liabilities, and documentation, it can become the very reason families face delays and disagreements instead of closure. Is your Will detailed enough to prevent that?

Why India's growing wealth is driving investment into luxury real estateAs capital increases, investors become more careful. The focus shifts from chasing returns to protecting value. This is why luxury real estate is gaining importance in serious portfolios.

Silver jumps over Rs 8,000: Time to invest, hold or sell?Silver shot up by over Rs 8,000, marking a fresh high in recent trading. With momentum high but volatility looming, the big question is: is it time to invest or sell?

What are Life Cycle Funds and how can they make your retirement planning easier?Life cycle funds are designed to adjust their asset allocation automatically as an investor moves closer to a specific goal, usually retirement.

Sensex closes 961 points lower: Why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.  Both indices lost over 1%.

Block's 4,000 job cuts: Why layoffs are no longer a sign of crisisBlock said it would cut more than 4,000 jobs, nearly half its workforce, reducing staff from over 10,000 to just under 6,000. This was not a company in distress. It was a company growing.
Sensex opens 277 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Infosys up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.29 points to 81,866.32, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 154.55 points to 25,342.00 as of 9:50 am.

Rs 583 crore returned, full-page ads out – is IDFC First Bank's trust push enough?IDFC First Bank's response offers a rare test of corporate accountability. But will a quick refund and bold messaging be enough to turn a damaging crisis into a chance to rebuild trust? We spoke to experts to understand what real recovery will demand.

Netflix calls Warner deal not attractive, clears path for ParamountNetflix declined to raise its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, clearing the way for Paramount's $31-per-share takeover offer that could reshape Hollywood and trigger major antitrust scrutiny.

Earning Rs 30 lakh a year but little wealth? Why many DINK couples fall behindWith two salaries and no childcare costs, DINK couples are often seen as having a clear financial advantage. Yet many high-earning couples find their wealth growing slower than expected. Is lifestyle inflation quietly eroding their investment potential?

India, Israel sign MoU to link UPI systems, boost digital payment tiesThe integration is expected to help Indian and Israeli businesses and individuals carry out financial transactions more easily. It could also reduce transaction costs and processing time, making payments faster and more convenient.

World Economic Forum chief Borge Brende quits amid probe into Epstein tiesBorge Brende, President and CEO of the World Economic Forum, has stepped down amid scrutiny over his past interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.

entertainment.headline: Front row at Shakira's concert? Singer's Mumbai show ticket hits Rs 32,000 After nearly 19 long years, Shakira is finally returning to India this April with electrifying shows lined up in Mumbai and Delhi. The buzz is sky-high, and so are the ticket prices, soaring up to Rs 32,000.

Is it really him? Jim Carrey's rare Paris appearance sparks buzz over new look Actor Jim Carrey made a rare public appearance at the Cesar Awards in Paris, instantly grabbing attention online.  Fans expressed their disbelief over his dramatically changed look.

Rajpal Yadav hits back at director Priyadarshan for saying he is poorly educated Rajpal Yadav addressed filmmaker Priyadarshan's remarks about his education and professionalism. He said he considers the director as his father figure.

Last flight out: Composer Santhosh Narayanan's lucky escape amid Middle East chaos Music composer Santhosh Narayanan shared his experience of leaving Qatar just ahead of airport shutdowns amid rising tensions between the US, Israel and Iran. Hours later, he confirmed that he had landed safely in the United States.

Rashmika-Vijay's Hyderabad wedding reception to be invite-only Rashmika and Vijay's wedding reception on March 4 will be a strictly invitation-only event. The reception will follow police recommendations to manage public excitement and ensure safety.

Rashmika-Vijay join Allu family for Sirish's Pelli Koduku ceremony. See pics Allu Sirish's pre-wedding celebrations drew major film industry personalities, with special attention on the presence of Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna. Sirish is set to marry fiancee Nayanika Reddy on March 6.

Bengali actor Subhashree Ganguly, son stranded in Dubai amid Middle East conflict Bengali actor Subhashree Ganguly and her young son Yuvaan are stuck in Dubai amid rising tension following Iranian attacks in the region. Her family hopes for their safe return.

Rashmika Mandanna invites Telangana CM Revanth Reddy to wedding reception Rashmika Mandanna met Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy to invite him to the reception of her wedding with Vijay Deverakonda, and shared pictures of the meeting.

Ram Charan begins dubbing for Peddi, shares fun studio video Ram Charan has started dubbing for the sports drama, Peddi, with the production team assuring audiences that the film will release worldwide on April 30, 2026 in multiple languages.

Rashmika-Vijay's first ad after wedding: Fans can't keep calm seeing the chemistry Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's first advertisement campaign together since their wedding is trending online. The chemistry the two actors share has captivated fans.

Ajith Kumar stranded in Dubai amid airspace shutdown, manager confirms he is safe Actor Ajith Kumar is currently unable to return to Chennai due to flight cancellations in Dubai, following the escalation of conflict between Israel and Iran. His manager has confirmed his safety.
Actor Sonal Chauhan, stranded in Dubai, says she's safe Sonal Chauhan assured fans she is safe in Dubai after being stranded due to flight cancellations amid tension in the Middle East.

Newlyweds Rashmika-Vijay seek blessings at Tirupati temple, distribute sweets Newly-wed Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna sought blessings at Tirumala Temple in Hyderabad and distributed sweets to devotees on Sunday, marking the start of a series of nationwide celebrations.

Sutapa Sikdar remembers Irrfan on anniversary, recalls his wish to marry again Sutapa Sikdar remembered late actor Irrfan on their wedding anniversary with an emotional note, recalling why they chose their wedding date and his wish to remarry after 25 years.

Rajpal Yadav's lawyer says complainant acted out of revenge, wanted him jailed Rajpal Yadav's lawyer accused businessman Madhav Gopal Agarwal of targeting the actor out of revenge in the Rs 9 crore loan case.

Prabhas to Vijay Deverakonda: Is scale swallowing the soul in Telugu films? From pan-India stars like Prabhas and Allu Arjun  to local gods like Nani and Vijay Devarakonda, the obsession for scale and spectacle has made the traditional family entertainer a rare spectacle in Telugu cinema.

Jack White to Mark Ruffalo, Hollywood celebs react to US-Israel strikes on Iran Several Hollywood celebrities, including Jack White, John Cusack, Mark Ruffalo and Carrie Coon, reacted on social media to the US and Israel's military strikes on Iran.

Shefali Shah on gender roles: Being equal to men is not an agenda Shefali Shah called for equal parenting responsibility, stressing that fathers play a crucial role in shaping children's values and respect towards women.

Actor Vishnu Manchu shares missile visuals from Dubai: No child should hear war Vishnu Manchu shared a disturbing video of missiles lighting up the Dubai sky amid rising Middle East tensions. He revealed that the loud interceptions frightened his daughter.

general news.headline: Head of snake cut off: US says Iran Revolutionary Guard's headquarters decimatedThe United States military on Monday claimed it had completely destroyed the Tehran headquarters of Iran's elite Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC).

IND vs WI: Sanju Samson's Virat Kohli-esque special powers India into semifinalIND vs WI, T20 World Cup Super 8: Sanju Samson produced a masterclass in chasing under pressure on Sunday, crafting an unbeaten 97 to lead India past West Indies' daunting 195 at Eden Gardens. India will take on England in the semifinals on Thursday in Mumbai.

Live: US, Gulf allies slam Iran's indiscriminate missile, drone attacks in M-EUS-Israel's Iran Strikes Live Updates: The Middle East remained on the boil for a second day on Sunday as Iran expanded its retaliation against the joint US-Israeli strikes that eliminated its Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and wiped out several senior figures of the Iranian military and political circles.

US President Donald Trump has countered Tehran's warning of attacks on American and Israeli interests by saying that such a move would invite consequences of "unprecedented" levels. Meanwhile, Iran's military retaliated across the Middle East with hundreds of missile and drone attacks, with the US confirming the first three deaths of American service members killed in the wider campaign.

During the day, Israel said it had launched another wave of strikes on Iran, while loud blasts were heard for a second day near Dubai and over Doha, after Iran launched retaliatory air attacks on the neighbouring Gulf states. Follow IndiaToday.in for live updates:

Air India extends UAE, Saudi, Israel, Qatar flight suspension until midnightLarge-scale disruptions have affected international travel, with hundreds of flights cancelled across major Indian airports, including Delhi and Mumbai, leaving passengers stranded as multiple Middle Eastern countries shut their airspace.

Khamenei's death: Have US, Israel achieved their goals, or is Iran unbreakable?Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's killing by the US and Israel was meant to break the system in Iran. Instead, it has tested it, and, for now, it has seemingly strengthened it. The conflict is widening across the Middle East, and it appears that Iran is not going to step back.

Iran conflict could last 4 weeks, assault on 'big country' takes time: TrumpPresident Donald Trump said the conflict with Iran may last about four weeks, described the campaign as unfolding as planned, confirmed U.S. casualties, and signalled he remains open to potential talks with Tehran.

Rajpal Yadav hits back at director Priyadarshan for saying he is poorly educatedRajpal Yadav addressed filmmaker Priyadarshan's remarks about his education and professionalism. He said he considers the director as his father figure.

B2 bombers, F-35 fighters, Nuke carriers: What US deployed in 24 hours in IranThe United States deployed advanced military assets, including B-2 stealth bombers, fighter jets and naval strike groups, to target Iran's leadership and critical military infrastructure.

Rashmika-Vijay join Allu family for Sirish's Pelli Koduku ceremony. See picsAllu Sirish's pre-wedding celebrations drew major film industry personalities, with special attention on the presence of Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna. Sirish is set to marry fiancee Nayanika Reddy on March 6.

Take that: Mohammad Amir severely trolled after India storm into T20 World Cup semisT20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Ex-Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir was trolled after India secured their berth in the semifinals with a five-wicket win over the West Indies on Sunday, March 1 at the iconic Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Worth the wait: Gambhir's mic and Samson's bat do the talking in KolkataIND vs WI, T20 World Cup: At Eden Gardens, Sanju Samson finally silenced the what ifs with a 97-run masterpiece. But in the press box, Gautam Gambhir was just getting started, dismantling data, defying tropes, and settling a few 2011-sized scores.

How CIA tracked Khamenei for months before deadly US-Israel strike on IranThe CIA monitored Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and other senior Iranian leaders for months, sharing intelligence with Israel that helped time the US-Israeli strike that ultimately killed Iran's Supreme Leader.

How failed nuclear talks became a death trap for KhameneiWhile US and Iranian envoys debated nuclear enrichment levels in Geneva, military planners in Washington and Tel Aviv were finalizing the coordinates for Operations Epic Fury and Roaring Lion – the twin operations that led to the toppling of the Khamenei regime in Iran.

Attacker who stabbed ex-Muslim YouTuber in UP killed in police encounterZeeshan, one of the men who stabbed ex-Muslim YouTuber Saleem Wastik in Ghaziabad, was killed in a police encounter on Sunday. Wastik is currently in critical condition.

Ordered to pay Rs 12,000 alimony, man claims Rs 9,000 salary. Court's responseThe Supreme Court questioned a man's claim that he earns only Rs 325 per day and cannot pay Rs 12,000 monthly alimony, calling it "impossible" in present times.

Full force: Trump vows relentless Iran campaign until objectives are metUS President Donald Trump described the weekend strikes on Iran, codenamed Operation Epic Fury, as 'one of the largest, most complex, most overwhelming military offensives the world has ever seen.'

Is it really him? Jim Carrey's rare Paris appearance sparks buzz over new lookActor Jim Carrey made a rare public appearance at the Cesar Awards in Paris, instantly grabbing attention online.  Fans expressed their disbelief over his dramatically changed look.

Is UAE a country? Who are the Gulf nations? Middle East geography explainedAmid rising tensions involving Iran, Israel and the US, many readers are confused about Middle East geography. Is the UAE a country or a group of nations? Which countries are called Gulf states? This explainer clearly breaks down the UAE structure, GCC members, and where Iran and Israel fit geographically.
Kashmir under curbs, Lal Chowk sealed; schools shut amid Khamenei's death protestsKashmir under curbs, Lal Chowk sealed; schools shut amid Khamenei's death protests

Pak erupts over Khamenei's killing, 21 dead as US consulates, UN office attackedAnger over Iran Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei's killing in US-Israeli strikes triggered unrest across Pakistan. Protesters attacked the US Consulate in Karachi, burned a UN office and held rallies in major cities.

Shai Hope snaps back at reporter, takes blame for West Indies' loss against IndiaWest Indies captain Shai Hope snapped back at a reporter and accepted blame for his team's loss against India in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 fixture in Kolkata. India's five-wicket win helped them secure a semi-final berth.

Shashi Tharoor thrilled for Sanju Samson: Thiruvananthapuram's son, pride of IndiaT20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Shashi Tharoor heaped praise on Sanju Samson after the Indian batter scored an unbeaten 97 and powered India into the semis with a five-wicket win over the West Indies on Sunday.

Video: Woman who lit cigarette with burning Khamenei photo celebrates his deathThe woman had previously drawn global attention when footage showed her setting fire to a printed image of Khamenei and using it to relight a cigarette.

Who is Alireza Arafi? Iran's interim leader after Khamenei's deathIn Iran, choosing a new supreme leader is meant to be the responsibility of the Assembly of Experts, a body of around 90 senior clerics who are elected every eight years.

sports.headline: Shai Hope snaps back at reporter, takes blame for West Indies' loss against India West Indies captain Shai Hope snapped back at a reporter and accepted blame for his team's loss against India in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 fixture in Kolkata. India's five-wicket win helped them secure a semi-final berth.

But in the press box, Gautam Gambhir was just getting started, dismantling data, defying tropes, and settling a few 2011-sized scores.

Manchester United in top three after come-from-behind win over Crystal Palace Premier League: Manchester United came back from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1 at home on Sunday. Under their interim boss Michael Carrick, United are unbeaten in seven and back in the top three for the first time since May 2023.

We all can go home with our heads held high: Shai Hope T20 World Cup, IND vs WI: West Indies captain Shai Hope reflected on his team's campaign after their exit in the Super 8 stages following a five-wicket defeat to India at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Sanju Samson is world-class, always knew he would deliver: Gautam Gambhir T20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to the press after India's Super 8 win over West Indies in Kolkata, head coach Gautam Gambhir heaped praise on Sanju Samson's unbeaten 97. He also outlined India's plans for Jasprit Bumrah and reiterated his belief in instinct over data and numbers.

With lessons from Rohit and Virat, Sanju Samson emerges India's hero in Kolkata Sanju Samson led India to a record-breaking T20 World Cup chase against the West Indies. He scored an unbeaten 97* (50) with the help of 12 fours and four sixes.

Shashi Tharoor thrilled for Sanju Samson: Thiruvananthapuram's son, pride of India T20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Shashi Tharoor heaped praise on Sanju Samson after the Indian batter scored an unbeaten 97 and powered India into the semis with a five-wicket win over the West Indies on Sunday.

Take that: Mohammad Amir severely trolled after India storm into T20 World Cup semis T20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Ex-Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir was trolled after India secured their berth in the semifinals with a five-wicket win over the West Indies on Sunday, March 1 at the iconic Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

IND vs WI: Sanju Samson's Virat Kohli-esque special powers India into semifinal IND vs WI, T20 World Cup Super 8: Sanju Samson produced a masterclass in chasing under pressure on Sunday, crafting an unbeaten 97 to lead India past West Indies' daunting 195 at Eden Gardens. India will take on England in the semifinals on Thursday in Mumbai.

Drop catches, out cheaply: Abhishek Sharma endures horror night at Eden Gardens T20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Abhishek Sharma had a night to forget at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata after he dropped two catches and scored only 10 runs off 12 balls against West Indies.

Suryakumar Yadav turns Superman, takes flying catch to dismiss Roston Chase India captain Suryakumar Yadav took a spectacular diving catch to dismiss Roston Chase during the Super 8 fixture of T20 World Cup 2026 against West Indies at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. Jasprit Bumrah claimed two key wickets in the 12th over to bring India back into the game.

MS Dhoni turns up the heat in first training session in Chennai before IPL 2026: VideoIPL 2026: MS Dhoni trained with full intensity at Chennai Super Kings' high-performance centre, ramping up preparations for another season of the tournament. On Saturday, the 44-year-old Dhoni reached Chennai and was greeted with loud cheers.

Sikandar Raza heroics in vain as rampaging South Africa storm into semis unbeatenT20 World Cup, SA vs ZIM: South Africa beat Zimbabwe by five wickets in New Delhi to continue their unbeaten run in the tournament. Sikandar Raza put in an incredible all-round showing, but it wasn't enough for Zimbabwe to win.

Alyssa Healy's farewell spectacle hands India crushing 0-3 whitewash in ODI seriesAustralia completed a dominant 3-0 sweep over India in the Women's ODI series at Hobart. Alyssa Healy's spectacular century marked her ODI farewell, while India struggled against the relentless Australian attack.

Shoaib Malik denies fourth marriage rumours, says wife Sana targeted by trollsFormer Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik denied rumours of a fourth marriage and condemned online misinformation. He warned of legal consequences for those spreading defamatory content affecting his family.

IND vs WI Highlights: Sanju Samson's 97* guides India into semi finalIndia (IND) vs West Indies (WI), T20 World Cup Highlights: India have progressed into the semi-final of the tournament as Sanju Samson's unbeaten 97 helps his team chase down 196 in 19.2 overs.

Watch: Stuck in Dubai, PV Sindhu shares update amid West Asia crisisPV Sindhu shared her first video from Dubai after being stranded due to the Iran attacks. She revealed an explosion occurred close to where she and her team were taking shelter at the airport.

Bairstow pleads for help as England Lions stranded in Dubai due to crisisStar England cricketer Jonny Bairstow has made an urgent plea for help after the England Lions squad was stranded in the United Arab Emirates amid escalating conflict in the Middle East.

India will play fire with fire vs West Indies: Assistant coach Ryan ten DoeschateT20 World Cup: India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate emphasised that the side won't leave any stones unturned against West Indies during their upcoming T20 World Cup clash. The two sides will face each other in Kolkata in a fight for a semi-final spot.

Shree Charani sets embarrassing ODI record for India with horror spell against AustraliaINDW vs AUSW, 3rd ODI: Shree Charani bowled the most expensive spell by an Indian spinner in ODIs with figures of 10-0-106-2 against Australia on Sunday at the Bellerive Oval in Hobart.

Should India give Bumrah the new ball? Dinesh Karthik urges key tweak for WI clashT20 World Cup: Dinesh Karthik urged India to hand Jasprit Bumrah the new ball. He believes early wickets from Bumrah could disrupt West Indies' power-hitters and shape India's chances in their must-win Super 8 clash.

Watch: Starc beams with pride as wife Healy scores 158 in stunning ODI farewellAustralia vs India: Veteran Australian pacer Mitchell Starc could not hide his pride on Sunday as his wife Alyssa Healy signed off from ODI cricket in grand style, smashing a breathtaking 158 against India in Hobart.

Don't call it Pakistan's team: Ex-batter's scathing attack after T20 World Cup exitICC T20 World Cup: Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali launched a strong attack on team management following Pakistan's early exit from the ongoing ICC tournament.

When cricket took a backseat as cringe ads and influencers took overT20 World Cup: This is not about influencers versus journalists. It is about why access is being decided by follower count instead of understanding of the game.

England Lions vs Pakistan Shaheens called off amid UAE security concernsThe ECB has cancelled the England Lions' second 50-over match in Abu Dhabi due to escalating security concerns in the Middle East. The situation has also delayed England Women's tour, although the senior men's team will continue with their T20 World Cup plans as scheduled

Don't make the Washington Sundar mistake: Ex-India cricketer wants unchanged XI vs WIT20 World Cup: Aakash Chopra warned India against tinkering with their Playing XI now. He stressed stability over experimentation ahead of the must-win clash vs West Indies

T20 World Cup: Akhtar, Ahmed slam 'clueless' Pakistan management after early exitShoaib Akhtar and Ahmed Shehzad sharply criticised Pakistan's team management after T20 World Cup exit. Their comments highlight deep concerns over tactical errors and lack of progress in three years.

West Indies, at home in Kolkata, stand between India and semifinalIND vs WI Preview, T20 World Cup: India are facing West Indies in a virtual knockout. Windies feel at home in Eden Gardens, having played two of their fixtures at the ground already. And they also have that one fond memory of 2016, where they beat England in the final of the tournament to clinch their second T20 World Cup.

Jayasuriya to step down as Sri Lanka coach after forgetful T20 World Cup run?T20 World Cup: Sanath Jayasuriya hinted at stepping down after Sri Lanka's T20 World Cup exit but has not taken a final decision yet. The coach remains open to discussions with Sri Lanka Cricket before deciding his future.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
